metadata.title: California Title 24 Part 6 Energy Compliance Requirements
metadata.source: California Title 24 Part 6 (Energy Code) + SF DBI Info Sheets M-03, M-04, M-06, M-08 + AB-112

code_cycle_note: 2022 Title-24 applies to permits filed before Jan 1, 2026. 2025 Title-24 applies to permits filed on/after Jan 1, 2026. Filing near the changeover requires careful code edition selection.

residential.description: Single-family, townhome, duplex. Low-rise (3 stories or less) multifamily uses LMCC/LMCI/LMCV forms starting with 2022 code.

attachment_1_building.title: Building Checklist
items: Envelope — insulation R-values, U-factors, SHGC for Climate Zone 3
Fenestration — window area, U-factor, SHGC compliance
Cool roof — aged solar reflectance and thermal emittance
Quality Insulation Installation (QII) — if used for compliance credit
Air sealing — building air leakage (CF3R-ENV-20a if HERS triggered)

attachment_2_mechanical.title: Mechanical Checklist
items: HVAC system efficiency — SEER/HSPF ratings
Duct insulation — R-value per climate zone
Duct leakage testing — if >25 ft new/replacement duct triggers HERS (CF3R)
Refrigerant charge verification
Ventilation — whole-house and local exhaust per ASHRAE 62.2
Water heating — fuel type, efficiency, pipe insulation

attachment_3_electrical.title: Electrical Checklist
items: Solar PV system — CF2R-PVB-01 required for new construction
Battery storage — CF2R-PVB-02 if triggered by performance approach
Electric-ready requirements — CF2R-ELC-01 for heat pump readiness
Lighting — high-efficacy light sources, JA8 compliance

hers_triggers.note: HERS rater verification (CF3R) is required when ANY of these conditions apply. Must register with HERS Provider Data Registry.
triggers: New duct system or >25 ft of replacement duct in existing home
Performance approach (CF1R-PRF-01) used for compliance — always requires HERS
Cool roof with specific reflectance credit

climate_zone_3_prescriptive.note: Key prescriptive values for SF (Climate Zone 3) — used when not doing performance approach

CF1R.purpose: Demonstrates project design and equipment comply with Energy Code

variants.CF1R-ALT-05: Prescriptive alterations NOT requiring HERS verification (simplified)

CF2R.purpose: Documents installed equipment meets CF1R specifications

CF3R.when_submitted: At inspection (field verification by HERS rater)
CF3R.purpose: Third-party field verification and diagnostic testing
CF3R.note: Only required when project triggers HERS measures. Must be registered with HERS Provider Data Registry.

variants.CF3R-MCH-28: Return duct design and air filter sizing

low_rise_multifamily.description: Low-rise multifamily (3 stories or less, 4+ units). Uses separate LMCC/LMCI/LMCV form system starting with 2022 Energy Code. High-rise multifamily (4+ stories) uses nonresidential NRCC/NRCI/NRCA forms.

building_type_boundary.low_rise_multifamily: 3 stories or fewer above grade, 4+ dwelling units — uses LMCC/LMCI/LMCV
building_type_boundary.single_family: 1-2 dwelling units (includes duplex, townhome) — uses CF1R/CF2R/CF3R
building_type_boundary.high_rise_residential: 4+ stories above grade — uses NRCC/NRCI/NRCA (nonresidential forms)
building_type_boundary.mixed_use_note: Ground floor commercial in a low-rise multifamily building requires NRCC for the commercial portion AND LMCC for residential portion. Two separate compliance documents.

LMCC.purpose: Demonstrates multifamily residential design complies with Energy Code. Covers dwelling units AND common areas.

variants.LMCC-PRF-01: Performance approach (energy modeling — most common for multifamily)

LMCC.common_areas_note: Common area corridors, lobbies, laundry rooms, and mechanical spaces are covered by LMCC — NOT by separate NRCC (unlike high-rise multifamily)

LMCI.purpose: Documents installed equipment meets LMCC specifications for each dwelling unit and common area

variants.LMCI-PVB-01: Photovoltaic systems (solar PV required for new construction)

LMCV.when_submitted: At inspection (field verification by HERS rater)
LMCV.purpose: Third-party field verification — applies to each dwelling unit. Must be registered with HERS Provider Data Registry.
LMCV.note: Required when project triggers HERS measures. For multifamily: HERS testing typically required for EVERY unit (not just a sample).

variants.LMCV-ENV-20a: Building air leakage test (per dwelling unit)
variants.LMCV-MCH-28: Return duct design and filter sizing

attachment_1_building.title: Building Checklist (per dwelling unit type)
items: Envelope — insulation R-values per unit type (varies by orientation)
Fenestration — U-factor and SHGC for each unit type
Cool roof — required for all units
Air sealing — LMCV-ENV-20a for each unit
Common area envelope compliance

attachment_2_mechanical.title: Mechanical Checklist
items: Individual unit HVAC — efficiency, duct sizing, duct leakage per unit
Central systems — if central HVAC, document system sizing for building
Water heating — individual vs central; solar thermal or heat pump options
Ventilation — dwelling unit and common area per ASHRAE 62.2

attachment_3_electrical.title: Electrical Checklist
items: Solar PV — LMCI-PVB-01 (sized per number of units)
Battery storage — LMCI-PVB-02 if required
Electric-ready — LMCI-ELC-01 for heat pump readiness
Common area lighting — high-efficacy required

multifamily_specific_requirements: Solar PV system sized based on number of dwelling units (not building footprint alone)
Each dwelling unit type needs separate compliance showing on LMCC
HERS testing required per individual dwelling unit (not a building-wide sample)
Common areas (corridors, lobbies, laundry) included in LMCC — separate from dwelling unit calculations
Mixed-use buildings need LMCC for residential + NRCC for commercial — two separate compliance documents

nonresidential.description: Commercial, retail, office, restaurant, hotel/motel, high-rise residential

NRCC.purpose: Demonstrates nonresidential building design meets Energy Code

NRCA.purpose: Verifies systems perform as designed (lighting controls, HVAC, etc.)

building_mechanical.description: Return duct design and filter sizing

NRCV.purpose: Third-party verification of installed systems — similar to residential HERS verification

low_rise_multifamily: LMCI at inspection per unit type
LMCV HERS testing per individual unit
Solar PV sized by number of units (LMCI-PVB-01)

residential: HERS if conditioned space added > thresholds
low_rise_multifamily: LMCI at inspection per added unit

residential.hvac_replacement: CF1R-ALT-05 (prescriptive, no HERS) OR CF1R-ALT-02 (requires HERS if >25ft duct replaced)
residential.water_heater_replacement: CF1R-ALT-05 sufficient for prescriptive approach. Note: changing fuel source has restrictions.
residential.window_replacement: CF1R required. U-factor and SHGC must meet climate zone 3 requirements.
residential.insulation: CF1R required. R-value must meet current code for climate zone 3.
residential.reroof: Cool roof requirements may apply (CF1R-ENV section)

nonresidential.hvac_replacement: NRCC required. Acceptance testing (NRCA) required for systems >54,000 BTU/hr.
nonresidential.lighting_replacement: NRCC for lighting power density. NRCA acceptance test for lighting controls.
nonresidential.envelope_changes: NRCC required for any changes to building envelope (windows, walls, roof).
nonresidential.tenant_improvement: NRCC required if altering lighting or HVAC. Common correction: TI permits filed without energy forms.

common_corrections.description: No energy compliance forms submitted with permit application
common_corrections.frequency: Very high — most common Title-24 correction
common_corrections.fix: Submit CF1R/NRCC with initial application. Many applicants don't realize alterations trigger Title-24.

common_corrections.description: Existing conditions not documented for alterations
common_corrections.frequency: High — #1 correction for alteration projects specifically
common_corrections.fix: CF3R-EXC-20 (Existing Conditions Verification) must be completed for alterations. Cannot prove compliance without baseline.

common_corrections.frequency: Medium — spikes near code changeover dates
common_corrections.fix: 2022 forms for permits filed before Jan 1, 2026. 2025 forms for permits filed on/after Jan 1, 2026.

common_corrections.description: Gas equipment specified in all-electric required project (SF-specific)
common_corrections.fix: New construction in SF must be all-electric. Title-24 docs cannot show gas consumption. Exception requires formal infeasibility review.

common_corrections.description: HERS verification required but not registered with provider
common_corrections.fix: If project triggers HERS measures, CF1R must be registered with HERS Provider Data Registry before permit issuance.

common_corrections.description: Prescriptive approach used when performance approach required
common_corrections.fix: If any element doesn't meet prescriptive minimums, must use performance approach (CF1R-PRF-01) which allows tradeoffs.

all_electric_new_construction.rule: All new construction must be all-electric. No gas infrastructure or piping.
all_electric_new_construction.exception_process: Formal infeasibility review by qualified engineers. Must demonstrate all available energy efficiency features were applied to all-electric option.
all_electric_new_construction.documentation: Title-24 compliance docs must not include gas consumption. AB-093 Attachment E required.

green_building_requirements.rule: Green Building Site Permit Submittal required for new construction permits. Documents compliance with SF Green Building Ordinance.
green_building_requirements.dbi_checklist_item: AB-093 Attachment E — Green Building compliance

final_compliance_affidavit.purpose: Clarifies the process for preparing and submitting required documentation to comply with Title-24 CEC and San Francisco Green Building Code (SFGBC).

inspection_checklists_by_project_type.nonresidential: M-04 — non-residential, high-rise residential, and hotel/motel buildings

final_compliance_affidavit.checklist_exemption: Installation documentation (M-03/M-04/M-08 checklists) NOT required for alterations to existing residential buildings where HERS field verification is not required — e.g., water heater replacement, window replacement, or additions <300 sq ft.
final_compliance_affidavit.form_code_tracking: Each inspection item has a corresponding form code entered into DBI Permit Tracking System. Items tracked for clearance prior to final inspection and Certificate of Final Completion.

title24_cec_compliance.certificates_required: Certificates of Installation, Acceptance, and Verification forms — specific forms indicated on M-03/M-04/M-08 checklists
title24_cec_compliance.retention: Completed and signed certificates maintained by building owner, available for DBI review upon request

affidavit_process.who_prepares: Responsible designer or energy consultant. For R3 occupancies, Owner/Builder may submit if they obtained the building permit.
affidavit_process.alternative_submitters: DBI may accept from mechanical, electrical, or plumbing contractor on their respective work scope.
required_contents: Company letterhead with address and contact info
Project data — address, scope, building permit application number, MEP permit numbers if applicable
List of required certificates per Title-24 CEC inspection checklists with form codes (e.g., NRCI-LTI-01-E (IE6), NRCA-LTI-02 (AE1))
Statement that all required certificates have been completed and signed
Name, signature, contact info, credential type (Engineer, Architect, Contractor, Owner/Builder for R3 only, Energy Consultant, ATT)
State license number (Engineer/Architect/Contractor) or certificate number (Testers/Consultants/HERS)

submittal.instruction: Email affidavit ONLY — do NOT attach Title-24 Certificates or Checklists
submittal.review_time: 10 business days — do NOT resubmit before 10 days
submittal.follow_up: If not cleared after 10 business days, call (628) 652-3407 with permit application number and affidavit date. Representative returns call within 72 hours.
submittal.status_check: sfgov.org/dbi — 'Completed Date' column indicates reviewed and approved affidavit

affidavit_process.hers_affidavit_rule: For HERS items, affidavit MUST be submitted by a certified HERS Rater
affidavit_process.att_affidavit_rule: For NRCA-MCH and NRCA-LTI/LTO acceptance tests, affidavit MUST be submitted by a certified ATT for mechanical systems/lighting controls

sfgbc_compliance.who_completes: Design Professional of Record (Option 1) or Green Building Compliance Professional of Record (Option 2)
sfgbc_compliance.when: Prior to final inspection of building permit
sfgbc_compliance.submittal: Submit by email along with Title-24 CEC Final Compliance Affidavit
sfgbc_compliance.applicability: New construction and major alterations only

effective_dates.2022_checklists: Effective for building permit applications submitted on/after January 1, 2023
effective_dates.ab093_attachment_e: Required for new construction and major alteration permits with final certificate after January 1, 2023
effective_dates.retroactive_note: 2022 SFGBC and 2022 CEC inspection checklists may be used for compliance with AB-093 for all previous code cycles
